013.omission_details: 60 instances in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14. Most look like miscoded fields. Also of limited public use?

016.omission_details: Over 244,000 instances in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14. Could map to misc_id, but this was initially considereed a low priority.

017.omission_details: 154 instances in UNC catalog as of 2019-06-14. At least in our catalog, users can't expect to find this information consistently. Could map to misc_id if necessary.

018.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
018.omission_details: Unique identification code for component parts appearing in monographs or continuing resources. Cryptic. Unlikely to assist with discovery.

025.omission_details: Internal to Library of Congress. Means nothing for our institutions.

026.omission_details: Used to assist in the identification of antiquarian books by recording information comprising groups of characters taken from specified positions on specified pages of the book. Example: 026 ##$ae-s- 11as$bs,me crth 3$c1797.$dv.1

031.omission_details: Only 5 instances of field in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14. Very cryptic and would take a lot of work to transform into something useful to end user. Could be useful in an eventual specialized music discovery tool, but this information might be coded elsewhere in the record in more usable ways.

032.omission_details: Number assigned to a publication for which the specified postal service permits the use of a special mailing class privilege.

033.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
033.omission_details: 15,564 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14. Could be useful, but this isn't really a chronological *subject* and it's not a publication, etc. date either. Would need to make decisions about whether this is useful for discovery and how to best use it.

034.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
034.omission_details: 56,450 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14. Could be useful in specialized cartographic discovery tool, but doesn't contribute much in the context of our general discovery application. Cryptic, not easily translated into user-sensible display. Information is usually recorded in less structured, more user-readable way elsewhere in record.

036.omission_details: 5 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14, all miscodings. Could fairly easily be mapped to misc_id if anyone else had more of this data and thought users would expect to search on or find this data in the catalog.

038.omission_details: 3 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-06-14. Highly unlikely to be kept updated/consistent in a library catalog. Of limited use for typical library discovery.

040.omission_details: Users don't care about the cataloging history of a record.

043.omission_details: Choice of geographic area code is usually based on the geographic names and/or subdivisions in 6XX subject added entry and index term fields. Revisit this decision if that practice ever changes.

045.omission_details: This could be very useful for discovery, but it'd be challenging to do it well. The field means something different for different formats, so we'd need to present it differently per format. Also the data is recorded in a cryptic way that would require complex transformation. Finally, we'd need to figure out how to present different types of dates (dates depicted, dates of content, dates of data generation, date of original composition (music), etc.)

046.omission_details: Could be useful, but the assumptions of the current catalog include one main publication date. We have few materials that need to use this field in lieu of 008 because of BCE dates. Would need to tangle with how to usefully surface inclusive/bulk dates in UI.

048.omission_details: Structured, coded form of data usually recorded in a human-readable, less machine-actionable form elsewhere in the record. If we ever support more advanced limits/structured searching for music display, map this field.

051.omission_details: Our items are not in LC collections

052.omission_details: 62,859 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. In many cases, appears to be an alternate method of encoding information already recorded in other fields we ARE mapping/using already

055.omission_details: Classification scheme not used in significant/meaningful way in our libraries

060.omission_details: NLM call numbers from ITEM OR HOLDINGS RECORDS should be being handled properly. Using bib 060 data might be of interest to our Health Science libraries for ebooks which may not have call numbers in items/holdings. This will only be useful AFTER there is a call number search/browse that handles NLM, however

061.omission_details: Our items are not in NLM collections

070.omission_details: Classification scheme not used in significant/meaningful way in our libraries

071.omission_details: Related to use of classification scheme not used in significant/meaningful way in our libraries

072.omission_details: Classification scheme not used in significant/meaningful way in our libraries

080.omission_details: Classification scheme not used in significant/meaningful way in our libraries

082.omission_details: DDC call numbers from ITEM OR HOLDINGS RECORDS should be being handled properly. Using bib 082/092 data might be of interest to our libraries using Dewey for ebooks which may not have call numbers in items/holdings. This will only be useful AFTER there is a call number search/browse that handles DDC, however

083.omission_details: 36 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31, several of them miscoded. If 082 is ever mapped from bibs, consider mapping 083 to support polyhierarchical classification

084.omission_details: Classification scheme not used in significant/meaningful way in our libraries

085.omission_details: *Deity* protect us from ever having to code/use this field in MARC

086.omission_details: SUDOC call numbers from ITEM OR HOLDINGS RECORDS should be being handled properly. Using bib 086 data might be of interest to our libraries for e-gov docs which may not have call numbers in items/holdings. This will only be useful AFTER there is a call number search/browse that handles SUDOC, however

242.omission_details: 627 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Could be mapped as title_variant, type:variant, label:Translation of title

243.omission_details: 2 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Could be incorporated in logic for creating this_work field if desired

256.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
256.omission_details: Data in this field tends to be recorded elsewhere now. This field contains a lot ofdetails that maybe seemed important in the early 1990s, but that no one really cares about in an online catalog --- the fact that a web page is "HTML encoded," or a file is "ca. 70 kilobytes," for instance

263.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
263.omission_details: If a to-be-published thing is not published yet, it's probably not available to our users. If it has been published, our users care about the 260/4 date, not this, which does serve an important function in pre-publication CIP records (this field is supposed to be removed from CIP records after an item is published, but that doesn't always happen)

270.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
270.omission_details: Not kept up-to-date when contact information changes. In general, we want our users to contact *us* when they have questions or issues about a resource, not some external contact.

306.omission_details: Usually duplicates data recorded in 300 and/or 505. Recorded in a cryptic manner and there's no way to specify which duration recorded goes with which part of the described item, if it's a multi-part thing

307.omission_details: No fields in UNC catalog. Hours an item is available is kind of a weird concept in the catalog, too.

336.omission_details: Terms used are not user-friendly; this information is usually better expressed elsewhere in the record

337.omission_details: Terms used are not user-friendly; this information is usually better expressed elsewhere in the record

338.omission_details: Terms used are not user-friendly; this information is usually better expressed elsewhere in the record

341.omission_details: New field introduced 2018-11. 0 occurrences in UNC catalog as of 2019-07-31. Could be important going forward if populated.

342.omission_details: Complex data mapping; appears in <2000 records in UNC catalog on 2018-05-21. Need to assess if this adds useful info, and if so, how to map.

348.omission_details: Look into whether it should map to genre

363.omission_details: Holdings-like hell format specifying exact dates; only 10 in UNC catalog, most look like they should be 362s

365.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
365.omission_details: We don't want to show this to users. It cannot be kept up to date

366.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
366.omission_details: We don't want to show this to users. It cannot be kept up to date

370.omission_details: 22 fields in UNC catalog -- maybe one day map to a subject-ish geographical entry or something?

377.omission_details: 1 field in UNC catalog -- maybe one day map to language facet if it adds unique info

381.omission_details: Mishmash of different kinds of data issuing body, arranged statement of music, version, or a geographic term with no coding that tells you what the data is

383.omission_details: Currently duplicates data recorded in other parts of the record, particularly 130 and 240 fields.

385.omission_details: Look into mapping to `note_general` with label `For audiences`

386.omission_details: Could eventually leverage in some "Works by" field, but only 248 fields in UNC's catalog today 2018-05-18

388.omission_details: Only 3 fields in UNC catalog on 2018-05-18. Eventually could be mapped as a chronological subject or something.

530.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
530.omission_details: Patrons do not care if item is available in another format if they cannot get to that format from our catalog. Midleading if not adjusted and kept current with our holdings

532.omission_details: New field introduced 2018-11. Textual/human-readable version of information coded in a more structured way in 341. 0 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Could be important going forward if populated.

542.omission_details: 276 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Initial decision to NOT map based on: historically NOT representing rights-holder in bibliographic descriptions --- seems potentially useful for internal library applications, but difficult to keep up-to-date across the board and not very useful for discovery. If the rights involve access restrictions, those are communicated to the end user in a 506

552.omission_details: 0 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Would be complex to transform into something that would make sense to a user in catalog display. Examples in MARC documentation aren't really enough to figure out what that logic would need to be

565.omission_details: 2 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Would require special logic to transform into a note that makes sense in the display

583.omission_details: Only select librarians can interpret and understand what this field means. Important for internal library work. Irrelevant for discovery.

588.omission_details: Public does not care what part of an item was used to create catalog description.

654.omission_details: 76 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Would require field-specific logic to process the data into headings and facet values

658.omission_details: 73 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Most of those look mis-coded

751.omission_details: Relatively new field, introduced 2017-12. 0 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. If it starts being populated in a useful way, perhaps it could be mapped to origin_place_facet / origin_place_search

753.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user

754.omission_details: 1 occurrence in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Seems relevant to plant/zoological collections

758.omission_details: New-ish field introduced 2017. 0 occurrences in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31. Not sure if/how this is being populated and whether it might be useful. Could have potential useful mappings to related_work field, but figuring that out would be a bit complex, and it might duplicate information recorded elsewhere in the record (?)

776.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
776.omission_details: Patrons do not care if item is available in another format if they cannot get to that format from our catalog. If not adjusted and kept current with our holdings, can be misleading and result in a link that returns only the record the link was in (because we don't have the thing in any other formats)

841.omission_details: item/holdings level data we are handling in other ways and NOT pulling from bib records

880.omission_details: 880s are handled like the fields they are linked to. Top-priority Argot fields already handle linked 880 fields, but there are other fields that still need to be set up to handle linked 880s. There are tickets for these in the TRLN JIRA

882.omission_details: Used in 'deleted' records that are still in a system. We are not showing deleted records in the online catalog

883.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
883.omission_details: Users don't care about the details of how/when metadata was generated

884.omission_reason_category: of limited use to typical user
884.omission_details: Users don't care if/how/when we converted a record from one cataloging standard to another

885.omission_details: Relatively new field, introduced 2016. On one hand, seems like it could maybe ever be used to improve rollup or matching against our load-time content-providing APIs. On the other, there is no clear standardization of how to use this field and that means the data in it is likely to become too messy to use for anything. As of 2019-07-31, the 40 occurrences in UNC catalog are in some Alexander Street Press vendor records

886.omission_details: 0 instances in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31 -- no need to support INTERMARC, UKMARC, etc.

887.omission_details: 0 instances in UNC catalog on 2019-07-31 -- no need to support non-MARC data embedded in MARC (shudder)
